lexUnit.name: shrink.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: become or make smaller in size or amount; contract

sentence.text: Over the last 100 years , the ice cap has shrunk in area from 20 kmsq to only 13 kmsq ; this year its thickness has dropped by 2.5 metres .
The whole business seemed to have shrunk in importance to the size of a peanut anyway .
Sue Cavanagh also discovered that loos are shrinking in size as well as in numbers .
True , betting turnover is now set to shrink in real terms this year , and the levy with it .
The biggest surprise here is that the TBM 700 seems to shrink into a much smaller and lighter aircraft when flown below ninety knots and down to the gear-down/flaps-down 61-knot stall speed .
All the anger she had ever felt seemed to shrink into no more than fits of petty temper in the face of what she was feeling now .
Her body seemed to have shrunk since Anthony 's death , giving her the appearance of an old woman .
Hasten , hasten , Dishayloo , before the globe itself shrinks to nothing !
His 43 per cent support has shrunk to 32 per cent , according to the latest poll .
The clouds have shrunk to wisps and the moon stands somewhere overhead , filling the view with silver .
Official forecasts suggest that the country 's GDP will shrink by 0.4% this year , and even that prediction now looks rosy .
In the next few decades , unless Japan somehow manages to arrest current trends , it may find that its share of global economic output has shrunk considerably .
The Funding sources are shrinking , but the needs grow explosively .
It was so wrinkled and shrunken and withered that it was difficult to say what it might have been .
